$pip install tox
$tox -egenconfig

comments.content:
Could u provide your pip version?
It seems that your pip version is lower. Try to upgrade it and try again.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jeffrey4l

comments.content:
You need pip at least the version in global requirements:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/tree/global-requirements.txt#n111
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dims-v

comments.content: please update pip/pbr/setuptools and reopen this bug if needed
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dims-v

comments.content:

comments.content:
Also, this seems relevant:

user@box:/opt/stack/glance$ ./.tox/pep8/bin/pip --version
pip 1.5.4 from /opt/stack/glance/.tox/pep8/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages (python 2.7)


I don't know where it's getting that version.

comments.content:
mriedem@ubuntu:~/git/nova$ pip show pbr pip setuptools virtualenv
/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pip/_vendor/requests/packages/urllib3/util/ssl_.py:90: InsecurePlatformWarning: A true SSLContext object is not available. This prevents urllib3 from configuring SSL appropriately and may cause certain SSL connections to fail. For more information, see https://urllib3.readthedocs.org/en/latest/security.html#insecureplatformwarning.
  InsecurePlatformWarning
You are using pip version 7.0.3, however version 7.1.2 is available.
You should consider upgrading via the 'pip install --upgrade pip' command.

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content: Make sure you have latest setuptools/pip/virtualenv.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
Here are all the dependencies I could find. Running this from my base Ubuntu install provided everything needed to get `tox -e pep8` to pass, at least in glance:

sudo apt-get install postgresql-server-dev-all python-dev python-pip libffi-dev gettext
sudo pip install --upgrade pip virtualenv setuptools pbr
sudo apt-get remove python-pip
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~avarner

comments.content:
avarner's suggestion above worked for me (*).

sudo apt-get install postgresql-server-dev-all python-dev python-pip libffi-dev gettext
sudo pip install --upgrade pip virtualenv setuptools pbr
sudo apt-get remove python-pip

Note: I tried this (above) and it didn't appear to work. I asked a question about this on IRC and then tried the suggestion again and it worked. 

Ergo: if it doesn't work at first, ask the question on IRC and then it'll work ;)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~amrith

comments.content: This bug affects OpenStack in general when running Tox on Debian or Ubuntu.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~federico-ceratto

comments.content:
This helped:

sudo apt-get purge python-tox    # Make sure there's no system-wide Tox
sudo pip install --upgrade pip virtualenv setuptools pbr tox      # Install/upgrade Tox as well

# Destroy and recreate the Tox virtualenvs
rm .tox -rf && tox -epy27  -v -v --notest
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~federico-ceratto

comments.content: We require a tox min version of 2.0 which has the support needed there. I don't think this is a valid bug for that reason.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague

comments.content:
@sdague: the issue still happens with the version of Tox from the Ubuntu Wily: 2.1.1-2

I was able to install Tox and Virtualenv without running the dangerous "sudo pip install":

sudo apt-get purge virtualenv tox 
sudo apt-get install python-pluggy python-pretend python-mock python-scripttest python-pytest python-stdeb 
sudo DEB_BUILD_OPTIONS=nocheck pypi-install virtualenv 
sudo DEB_BUILD_OPTIONS=nocheck pypi-install tox 
virtualenv --version ; tox --version
rm .tox -rf && tox -epy27 -v -v --notest
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~federico-ceratto

comments.content: I'm going to re-target this at the upstream Designate project since it doesn't appear to have anything to do with the Ubuntu Designate package.  Ubuntu packages don't use pip or tox.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~corey.bryant

comments.content: I've marked this as invalid for Ubuntu Designate package since it appears to have nothing to do with it.  Ubuntu packages don't use pip or tox.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~corey.bryant
